title: Introducing: Saint Savanna
body:
**Mumford & Sons** have ruined so much that was once dear to so many: berets, banjos and stereotypical Britishness, to name but a few.

Having left a sizeable brown mark on the underpants of folk-pop, what makes it even worse is that bands like The Lumineers appear to enjoy trying to replicate the sort of mind-numbing drivel that Mumford & Co. excrete. A minute  or so into this debut EP from Brighton’s [Saint Savanna](http://www.facebook.com/SaintSavanna) and you’d be forgiven for thinking that they’re just another tweed-wearing, genre-blaspheming bunch of fanny-monkeys. Thankfully, it’s not stereotypical of their sound, and by the time the chorus of _You Won’t Rise_ kicks in, they’ve well and truly extinguished any Mumford related demons.

With lines like “_thank you for being so brutally honest, but fuck you for saying that you didn’t want this_“, there’s a snarl to **Saint Savanna** that is rarely experienced in a ‘folky’ outfit. In truth, it’s only the opening track that has any hints of Mumford to it; _Balconies_ is dream-pop at it’s finest – slightly cheesy and irrepressibly slick. One gets the feeling that **Saint Savanna** are still to find their ‘internet feet’, mainly due to their modestly sized fanbase in proportion to the quality of their music, however with the right direction, expect to hear a lot more of them over the coming months. Check out their debut EP _**Verona**_ below.
